snippet: The deal would be the latest in a wave of consolidation as chip makers look to increase their scale and product offerings.
abstract: Intel says it will pay $16.7 billion to acquire Altera, latest in series of consolidations in computer chip-making industry; company hopes acquisition will help it enter growing market for supplying large data centers as Altera's primary chips are more flexible and allow customers a way to tailor chips for their specific needs.

byline.original: By QUENTIN HARDY and CHAD BRAY
byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The deal would be the latest in a wave of consolidation as chip makers look to increase their scale and product offerings.

headline.main: Intel Agrees to Buy Altera for $16.7 Billion
headline.print_headline: Intel in Deal for Altera, a Rival Chip Maker
